alert.note: Alert for Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 2:52PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Musselshell and northeastern Yellowstone Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles southwest of Melstone, or 22 miles east of Roundup, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Musselshell and northeastern Yellowstone Counties. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
